titles.title: Milk Marketing Control Act of 1987
A bill to amend the Agricultural Act of 1949 to provide for the modification of the milk price support system contingent on the results of a producer referendum.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to Subcommittee on Livestock, Dairy, and Poultry.

bill.summary: 1/7/1987--Introduced. Milk Marketing Control Act of 1987 - Amends the Agricultural Act of 1949 to direct the Secretary of Agriculture to conduct two referendums (one for 1988, the other for 1989 and 1990) among milk producers to determine whether to implement an alternative milk price support program for the respective periods based on individual milk marketing bases and a 70 percent of parity support level. Directs the Secretary, prior to the beginning of 1994, to conduct a study of the economic impact of this Act and such alternative price support system. Continues such system beyond calendar year 1993 unless the Congress disapproves it, by joint resolution, prior to July 1, 1993. Sets the support level at 75 percent of the parity price if the Congress disapproves such system.
